revised_title: Evolution of Lethals in the Haplotype System of the Mouse
tldr: The author examines the evolution of lethal haplotypes in the haplotype segregation distortion system of the mouse through mathematical and computer models. The models consider reproductive compensation for the loss of lethal embryos, allowing for the spread of recessive lethals and the establishment of polymorphic equilibrium. The introduction of a second lethal mutation on a non-lethal haplotype can increase its frequency and displace non-lethal haplotypes. The theoretical predictions are compared with data on natural populations.
